title: 103_hr5306
content: The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1994, also known as the Act, reduces individual income tax rates. No amendments or changes in rates made by the Act will be considered as a change in tax rate for certain purposes. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1994 reduces individual income tax rates by repealing the 39.6% rate bracket and making additional rate reductions in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1994 reduces individual income tax rates by substituting specified percentages for 15%, 28%, 31%, and 36% in subsections (a), (b), (c), (d), and (e) for taxable years beginning after 1994. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1994 reduces individual income tax rates by substituting specified percentages for different income brackets for taxable years beginning after 1994. The corresponding percentages for each bracket are adjusted annually, with the rates decreasing over time. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1994 amends various sections of the tax code, including technical amendments to rate reductions and adjustments. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 1994. Additionally, the act repeals the overall limitation on itemized deductions. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1994 repeals the overall limitation on itemized deductions under Section 68 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It also repeals the phaseout of personal exemptions for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1994. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF PHASEOUT OF PERSONAL EXEMPTIONS. The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1994.
